title: Ticket #2649: Have subdag external functionality w/o an actual extra DAGMan
description:
Logan from Botany would like to be able to do abort-dag-on on a splice (or, equivalently, have some way to do 'subdag external' without actually submitting a second DAGMan).

Given the way the code is structured, I think this will be pretty hard...
remarks:
2012-May-09 15:51:16 by nwp:
Could we just get rid of SUBDAG EXTERNAL and SPLICE, and just have SUBDAG? Are people wedded to this notion of having an external DAGman? Idea is to combine the best of both SPLICE and SUBDAG EXTERNAL:

  1. Category work across the whole DAGman job
  2. When subdag completes, the DAGman contracts the subdag by releasing the memory associated with the nodes.
  3. SUBDAGs can have FINAL nodes
  4. SUBDAGs can ABORT, etc.

Do people use a job_status file in a nested dag, without one for the "nesting" dag?
